Understate: The claim may understate the fact that only noncitizens who have been authorized to work and have a Social Security number can receive stimulus checks, excluding most immigrants who are not in the U.S. legally.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the assertion that "illegal aliens" will receive $1400 stimulus checks.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the assumption that all "illegal aliens" would be eligible for stimulus checks, without considering the requirements and limitations set by the legislation.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation by stating that only noncitizens who have been authorized to work and have a Social Security number may be eligible for stimulus checks, even if they overstayed their visas.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Biden's COVID-19 relief package excludes most immigrants who aren't in the U.S. legally from receiving stimulus checks, similar to the relief packages enacted during the Trump administration.
